ShouldersCBLateralRaise.name: Cable Lateral Raise
ShouldersCBLateralRaise.preparation: With low pulleys to each side, grasp left stirrup with right hand and right stirrup with left hand. Stand upright.
ShouldersCBLateralRaise.execution: With elbows slightly bent, raise arms to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersCBLateralRaise.comments: Maintain fixed slightly bent elbow position throughout exercise. Stirrup is raised by shoulder abduction, not external rotation. Also see Cable Lateral Raise performed with pulleys very close together.

ShouldersCBOneArmLateralRaise.name: Cable One Arm Lateral Raise
ShouldersCBOneArmLateralRaise.preparation: Grasp stirrup cable attachment. Stand facing with side of resting arm toward low pulley. Grasp ballet bar if available.
ShouldersCBOneArmLateralRaise.execution: With elbow slightly bent, raise arm to side away from low pulley until elbow is shoulder height. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersCBOneArmLateralRaise.comments: Maintain fixed elbow position (10 to 30 angle) throughout exercise. Stirrup is raised by shoulder abduction, not external rotation.

ShouldersCBLateralRaiseClose.name: Cable Lateral Raise (pulleys close)
ShouldersCBLateralRaiseClose.preparation: Stand facing two low pulleys positioned side by side. Grasp stirrups with each hand. Stand upright with arms staight down to each side.
ShouldersCBLateralRaiseClose.execution: With elbows slightly bent, raise arms to side until elbows are shoulder height. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersCBLateralRaiseClose.comments: Maintain fixed slightly bent elbow position throughout exercise. Stirrup is raised by shoulder abduction, not external rotation.

ShouldersCBSeatedLateralRaise.name: Cable Seated Lateral Raise
ShouldersCBSeatedLateralRaise.preparation: Sit on seat above twin cable pulleys. Grasp stirrups on each side. Sit upright with arms nearly straight down to each side.
ShouldersCBSeatedLateralRaise.execution: With elbows slightly bent, raise arms to side until elbows are shoulder height. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersCBSeatedLateralRaise.comments: Maintain fixed slightly bent elbow position throughout exercise. At top of movement, elbows (not necessarily dumbbells) should be directly lateral to shoulders since elbows are slightly bent forward. Stirrup is raised by shoulder abduction, not external rotation. If elbows drop lower than wrists, front deltoids become primary mover instead of lateral deltoids.

ShouldersCBUprightRow.name: Cable Upright Row
ShouldersCBUprightRow.preparation: Grasp cable bar with shoulder width or slightly narrower overhand grip. Stand close to pulley.
ShouldersCBUprightRow.execution: Pull bar to neck with elbows leading. Allow wrists to flex as bar rises. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersCBUprightRow.synergists: infraspinatus, brachioradialis, serratusanterior, bicepsbrachii, brachialis, supraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidanterior, trapeziuslower, teresminor

ShouldersCBBarUprightRow.name: Cable Bar Upright Row
ShouldersCBBarUprightRow.preparation: Grasp cable bar with shoulder width or slightly narrower overhand grip. Stand close to cable bar.
ShouldersCBBarUprightRow.execution: Pull bar to neck with elbows leading. Allow wrists to flex as bar rises. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersCBBarUprightRow.synergists: infraspinatus, brachioradialis, serratusanterior, bicepsbrachii, brachialis, supraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidanterior, trapeziuslower, teresminor

ShouldersCBUprightRowDualPulley.name: Cable Upright Row (dual pulley)
ShouldersCBUprightRowDualPulley.preparation: Stand between low dual pulleys. Grasp handles with opposite hands  right hand holds left stirrup and left hand holds right stirrup. Stand upright with arms straight and palms facing back (overhand grip), one stirrup in front of other.
ShouldersCBUprightRowDualPulley.execution: Pull handles up to front of shoulders with elbows leading and cables crossed. Allow wrists to flex as stirrups are lifted. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersCBUprightRowDualPulley.comments: To prevent cable parts from catching, stand with body turned very subtly to side of cable behind other. Positioning one cable slightly in front of other cable may result in slight asymmetrical movement. Therefore, alternate opposite arm positions every other workout or set. See Upright Row Safety. Also see Cable Upright Row with two stirrup attachments attached to single pulley cable.
ShouldersCBUprightRowDualPulley.synergists: infraspinatus, brachioradialis, serratusanterior, bicepsbrachii, brachialis, supraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidanterior, trapeziuslower, teresminor

ShouldersCBOneArmUprightRow.name: Cable One Arm Upright Row
ShouldersCBOneArmUprightRow.preparation: Grasp stirrup on low pulley with overhand grip. Stand with side of arm with stirup away from pulley machine, arm against front of body. Place other hand on ballet bar or side of pulley column for support.
ShouldersCBOneArmUprightRow.execution: Pull stirup to front side of shoulder with elbow leading. Allow wrist to flex as stirrup is lifted. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersCBOneArmUprightRow.synergists: infraspinatus, brachioradialis, serratusanterior, bicepsbrachii, brachialis, supraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidanterior, trapeziuslower, teresminor

ShouldersCBUprightRowRope.name: Cable Upright Row (with rope attachment)
ShouldersCBUprightRowRope.preparation: Grasp each side of rope with overhand grip, just under rope ends. Stand close to pulley.
ShouldersCBUprightRowRope.execution: Pull rope ends to front of shoulders with elbows leading. Allow wrists to flex as stirrups are lifted. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersCBUprightRowRope.synergists: infraspinatus, brachioradialis, serratusanterior, bicepsbrachii, brachialis, supraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidanterior, trapeziuslower, teresminor

ShouldersCBUprightRowStirrups.name: Cable Upright Row (stirrup attachments)
ShouldersCBUprightRowStirrups.preparation: Grasp handles of both stirrups with overhand grip. Stand close to pulley.
ShouldersCBUprightRowStirrups.execution: Pull handles to front of shoulders with elbows leading. Allow wrists to flex as stirrups are lifted. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersCBUprightRowStirrups.comments: Setup requires attaching two stirrup attachments to single pulley cable. Also see Cable Upright Row with dual pulley. See Upright Row Safety.
ShouldersCBUprightRowStirrups.synergists: infraspinatus, brachioradialis, serratusanterior, bicepsbrachii, brachialis, supraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidanterior, trapeziuslower, teresminor

ShouldersCBWideGripUprightRow.name: Cable Wide Grip Upright Row
ShouldersCBWideGripUprightRow.preparation: Grasp cable bar with wide overhand grip. Stand close to pulley.
ShouldersCBWideGripUprightRow.execution: Pull bar to neck with elbows leading. Allow wrists to flex as bar rises. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersCBWideGripUprightRow.comments: See Upright Row Safety. Also see side view.
ShouldersCBWideGripUprightRow.synergists: infraspinatus, brachioradialis, serratusanterior, bicepsbrachii, brachialis, supraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidanterior, trapeziuslower, teresminor

ShouldersCBYRaise.name: Cable Y Raise
ShouldersCBYRaise.preparation: Stand facing between low pulleys medium width apart, grasp left stirrup with right hand and right stirrup with left hand. Step back slightly away from pulleys and stand upright with cables crossed in front of hips.
ShouldersCBYRaise.execution: With elbows slightly bent, raise arms upward and outward to sides in Y configuration until elbows are approximately lateral to each ear. Lower stirrups forward and downward in reverse pattern. Repeat.
ShouldersCBYRaise.comments: Maintain fixed slightly bent elbow position throughout exercise. Stirrup is raised by combining shoulder abduction and flexion. Slight shoulder external rotation may occur with elbows bent. Front Deltoid assists shoulder flexion if upper arm angle is slightly high. Rear Deltoid assists shoulder horizontal abduction if upper arm angle is slightly low. Also see Cable Seated Y Raise on dual pulley Cable Row machine.
ShouldersCBYRaise.synergists: infraspinatus, serratusanterior, deltoidposterior, supraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidanterior, trapeziuslower, teresminor

ShouldersCBSeatedYRaise.name: Cable Seated Y Raise
ShouldersCBSeatedYRaise.preparation: On dual pulley seated row machine, sit slightly forward on seat or bench in order to grasp both cable attachments. Place feet on vertical platform. Position torso upright and slide hips back so knees are slightly bent.
ShouldersCBSeatedYRaise.execution: Raise arms upward and outward to sides in Y configuration while allowing elbows to partially bend. Pull back until elbows are approximately lateral to each ear. Lower stirrups forward and downward until arms are extended straight in front of body. Repeat.
ShouldersCBSeatedYRaise.comments: Keep torso upright throughout exercise. Stirrup is raised by combining shoulder abduction and flexion. Slight shoulder external rotation may occur with elbows bent. Front Deltoid assists shoulder flexion if upper arm angle is slightly high. Rear Deltoid assists shoulder horizontal abduction if upper arm angle is slightly low. Also see Cable Seated Y Raise on single pulley machine with rope attachment.
ShouldersCBSeatedYRaise.stabilizers: wristextensors, trapeziusupper, hamstrings, gluteusmaximus, adductors, levatorscapulae
ShouldersCBSeatedYRaise.synergists: infraspinatus, serratusanterior, deltoidposterior, supraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidanterior, trapeziuslower, teresminor

ShouldersCBSeatedYRaiseRope.name: Cable Seated Y Raise (with rope attachment)
ShouldersCBSeatedYRaiseRope.preparation: Sit slightly forward on seat or bench and grasp ends of rope attachment with hand. Place feet on vertical platform. Slide hips back so knees are slightly bent.
ShouldersCBSeatedYRaiseRope.execution: With torso upright pull rope upward over head until elbows are approximately lateral to each ear. Lower stirrups forward and downward until arms are extended straight in front of body. Repeat.
ShouldersCBSeatedYRaiseRope.comments: Keep torso upright while maintaining fixed slightly bent elbow position throughout exercise. Stirrup is raised by combining shoulder abduction and flexion with slight external rotation. Also see Cable Seated Y Raise on dual pulley machine with stirrup attachments.
ShouldersCBSeatedYRaiseRope.stabilizers: wristextensors, trapeziusupper, hamstrings, gluteusmaximus, adductors, levatorscapulae
ShouldersCBSeatedYRaiseRope.synergists: infraspinatus, serratusanterior, deltoidposterior, supraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidanterior, trapeziuslower, teresminor
